title: Rear Brake Disc - Installation

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Thoroughly clean the mating faces of the components prior to installation.
Clean the brake disc, pulser ring and rear axle shaft.
Fit the disc to the rear axle shaft.
Position the pulser ring to the brake disc making sure the dot marks face away from the brake disc and the pulser ring is centrally aligned.
Using an internal thread repair tool, make sure the rear axle shaft internal threads of the brake disc fixing are cleaned and dried prior to installation of the new fixings.
Do NOT use a tap as this may damage the threads
Following the fitment of the first brake disc fixing, the remaining fixings must be fitted and torqued within 10 minutes. Do not leave any longer in a partially assembled condition.
Apply a single line of ThreeBond 1375B thread lock to one of the new brake disc fixings as shown.
Insert the fixing into the rear axle shaft to secure the pulser ring and brake disc assembly. Do not torque at this stage.
Repeat the thread lock application for the remaining three fixings and fit them to the rear axle shaft.
Alignment dots (one of four sets shown)
Support the rear axle shaft carefully to avoid damage to the disc or axle shaft threads.
Apply a layer of Castrol High Temperature grease to the rear axle shaft in the area shown.
